text: hello this is Bill Cunningham reporting
in the middle of New York's Christmas
week and what a week of festivities you
just stand on Fifth Avenue and the world
will pass you by during Christmas week
it's simply wonderful all the grumpy
face people seem to have left and all
the tourists coming they're so happy is
simply wonderful you got imagine the
only snowman that I saw and we're in the
shop windows there was no snow and then
on Fifth Avenue you spot marvelous
looking people people who care and dress
up to come on Fifth Avenue a young
school group from Japan and they were
seven or eight of them all in the same
pockets and then comes that really
magical night christmas eve and on Fifth
Avenue the church bells of breaking the
silence and it's perfectly beautiful and
on Christmas night the real action move
down to the Bryant Park skating rink
what a wonderful way to end the day and
of course on Christmas Day the families
at Rockefeller Center and the little
children just in or of everything as I
say and then on the twenty-sixth of
December at eight in the morning there
was a mad scramble and dash at Saxons
Avenue with over a thousand people there
hunting for bargains and as the week
unfolded you had the very formal white
glove debutante cotillion balls it's
quite a scene and it's a facet of New
York and then of course on New Year's
Eve the display of fireworks over
Central Park and finally Christmas in
New York is a
